Description: Lip and body fragment of East Greek pottery bowl; interior black with two pairs of red stripes, one below the lip, the other on lower part of body; exterior: reserved band in handle-zone and on lower part of wall; inscription cut inside, facing out.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Edgar incorrectly identifies the sherd as Chian.
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (pl. IV, no. 7)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 696, no. 529)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1000)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
